newsitem.title: USA: Tejas rallies sharply on upgrade.
newsitem.headline: Tejas rallies sharply on upgrade.

text.p: Shares in Tejas Gas Corp rose two points, or 4.46 percent, to 47, after Merrill Lynch analyst John Olsen raised his rating on the stock to near-term buy from accumulate.
The wider S&P 500 index was up 0.79 percent and the S&P Oil & Gas Index was up 0.35 percent.
On May 7, the company said that its first quarter earnings per share rose to $0.55 from $0.51 a year ago.

The Houston-based gas gatherer and marketer said that a 59 percent increase in revenues and 62 percent rise in cash operating income in the quarter was due to its acquisition of Transok Inc in June 1996. ((-- David Chance New York Newsroom 212 859 1902))
